intro: Scleranthus fastigiatus, commonly known as the upright thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has erect, branching stems covered in stiff hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides or in dry, open habitats. Scleranthus fastigiatus is typically short-lived, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
